item.title: [423] SCRAPPED - AccessorMethods class
item.dc:creator: @NOURLOL NOURLOL
item.description:
@NOURLOL wrote:

I created:

[code]
import org.regecks.bot.*;

public class Test {

private static client c;

public static void main(String[] args) {
	c = new client();
	client.main(new String[] { "1", "live", "live", "lowmem", "free", "english"});
	while(true) {
		try {
			try {
			System.out.println(AccessorMethods.getPosition());
			}
			catch(Exception e) { }
			Thread.sleep(5000);
		}
		catch(Exception e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
	}
}

}[/code]
With a quick patch to client.main to load an inetaddress, and output:

$ java -cp . Test 10032,9632
Started working as soon as I logged in.[br][size=1]Posted at: August 12, 2006, 04:38:27 PM[/size][hr]Also, bugfix, see first post.

Read full topic

item.title: [423] SCRAPPED - AccessorMethods class
item.dc:creator: @NOURLOL NOURLOL
item.description:
@NOURLOL wrote:

“final /super/ synchronized class uc”
No, not public, but dependant. You need to be launching the app with both the client classes & ClientFunctions in your initial classpath.

And, I assume you’re trying to get “uc.n”, n is also not public, but dependant, which is why the client & ClientFunctions must BOTH be in the INITIAL classpath.

Read full topic

item.title: [423] SCRAPPED - AccessorMethods class
item.dc:creator: @NOURLOL NOURLOL
item.description:
@NOURLOL wrote:

This idea has been scrapped, see my post down a bit.

Hi,
This is sort of a new idea I’m trying.
My bot/updater generates a class using BCEL, that are basically accessor methods (get/set) for the original (not deobfuscated client).
Here is a list that I have that I will be expanding for my bot:

public class AccessorMethods extends org.regecks.bot.ClientFunctions{ public static int[] getActionData1(); public static int[] getActionData2(); public static int[] getActionData3(); public static int[] getActionData4(); public static int getDataRow(); public static java.awt.event.MouseListener getMouseListener(); public static java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener getMouseMotionListener(); public int[] getAction(int); public static byte[][][] getByteGroundArray(); public static int[] getModelIntArray1(); public static int[] getModelIntArray2(); public static int getPlane(); public static java.lang.Object myPlayer(); public static int getYCameraCurve(); public static int getXCameraCurve(); public static java.lang.Object[] getNpcArray(); public static java.lang.Object[] getPlayerArray(); public static java.lang.Object getNpcDesc(java.lang.Object); public static int findNPCByName(java.lang.String); public static java.lang.String getNpcName(java.lang.Object); public static Tile getBase(); public static int[][] getSmallPos(java.lang.Object); public static Tile getRawPos(java.lang.Object); public static Tile getLocalPosition(java.lang.Object); public static Tile getPosition(java.lang.Object); public static Tile getPosition(); public static Tile getMousePosition(); public static java.lang.String getStringFromWrapper(java.lang.Object); public static int[][][] getIntGroundArray(); public static int getXCameraPos(); public static int getYCameraPos(); public static int getZCameraPos(); public static int getTextureInt1(); public static int getTextureInt2(); public static Tile tileToScreen(Tile); public static Tile getEntityScreenPos(java.lang.Object); protected static Tile worldToScreen(int, int, int); public static int calculateTerrain(int, int); }

So far you can see there’s not much important there, unless you like getNPCArray or say, tileToScreen which turns a world coordinate into an on-screen position, but there will be more, I promise.

Would people be interested in this kind of thing? I will be eventually expanding it until it can be used to make a fully functional bot.

I will provide you with the above AccessorMethods class, with ClientFunctions+Tile also. Note, this is for the non-deobfuscated client only.
Please post your interest here if you’re interested in this kind of thing in the future.

Download for 423: http://www.jagex.biz/am_public/423_release.rar

This should aid you if you’re interested in making a bot, as I said before, the list will expand very quickly.

THERE IS CURRENTLY A BUG IN THE CURRENT ACCESSORMETHODS UNDER getPosition(void), YOU MAY FIX IT BY CHANGING GETRAW->GETLOCAL

Read full topic
